alert.note: Alert for Koochiching; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 3:08PM CDT until June 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, in north central Minnesota, Koochiching. In northeast Minnesota, St. Louis. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lakes, rivers, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM CDT, Flooding continues in the warned area. - The level of Namakan Lake is expected to fall by 15 to 17 inches between June 29th and July 6th. The level of Rainy Lake is expected to fall by 9 to 11 inches between June 29th and July 6th. The decline in all levels and flows is expected to continue beyond the seven day period. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... International Falls, Kabetogama, Crane Lake, Kabetogama Lake, Voyageurs National Park, Rainy Lake East, Rainy Lake West, northwestern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Ranier, Ray, Island View, Ericksburg, Johnson Lake and Sand Point Lake. - For more information about the Rainy Lake Basin flooding visit, https://weather.gov/dlh/RainyRiverBasin .
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
